New Records: Anthony Santander hit his 42nd home run of the season with a walk-off two-run homer
Key Match Events: Anthony Santander hit a game-ending two-run homer with two outs in the ninth inning
Casey Schmitt tied the game at 3-all with a single off Seranthony Domínguez in the top of the ninth
Austin Slater got his glove to Anthony Santander's walk-off homer but couldn’t hold on while colliding with center fielder Cedric Mullins
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles were coming off a three-game losing streak and eight of their last 10 games
Post-Match Reflections: Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said the win was a needed one for the team
Giants manager Bob Melvin said the team came back in the ninth but fell an at-bat short
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles moved three games ahead of idle Kansas City for the top AL wild card and pulled within four games of the AL East-leading New York Yankees
The Giants were eliminated from playoff contention
Others: Mullins received medical attention but remained in the game
